summary: This is an email chain forwarding a courtesy copy of an ECF filing in the case U.S. v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It includes a cover email from an Assistant United States Attorney and the original email from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim, who attaches a filing related to Maxwell's detention conditions.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Sends the email forwarding the attached filing from the defense to the recipient(s). Works in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who sends the original email attaching a courtesy copy of an ECF filing in U.S. v. Maxwell. She provides her law office details and a COVID-19 notice.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on Bobbi Sternheim's original email regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on Bobbi Sternheim's original email regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) on Bobbi Sternheim's original email regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell.

events.title: ECF Filing in U.S. v. Maxwell
events.description: Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim files a document (attached as 'MDC Conditions_Letter_2-16_FINAL.pdf') related to Maxwell's detention conditions, which is then forwarded by a prosecutor.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, 33 West 19th Street - 4th Floor, New York, NY 10011
keyFacts: The document is an email chain from February 16, 2021, concerning the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim files a document related to Ghislaine Maxwell's detention conditions (MDC Conditions_Letter_2-16_FINAL.pdf).
The email shows coordination among Maxwell's defense team, including Bobbi C. Sternheim, Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.
An Assistant United States Attorney named Maurene forwards the defense filing, indicating ongoing legal proceedings.
The correspondence includes a COVID-19 notice stating Sternheim's office is closed but working remotely.
